snippet: With his slight figure and pensive disposition, Ammar Cheikh Omar seems more like a contemplative philosophy student than a would-be Syrian Rambo. But the 29-year-old defector from the Syrian Army insists it is time for the Syrian opposition to shed...
abstract: With his slight figure and pensive disposition, Ammar Cheikh Omar seems more like a contemplative philosophy student than a would-be Syrian Rambo. But the 29-year-old defector from the Syrian Army insists it is time for the Syrian opposition to shed its passive philosophizing. It is time, he says, to take up arms. He and other young Syrians are fed up with the passive resistance espoused by their opposition leaders. Gandhi's ideology, he says ruefully, is no match for a loaded AK-47. Guns must be met with guns.

headline.main: Syrian Defector: More Guns, Less Gandhi
